content:
ethJS seems to fail with all the clients :/
```
[el-32-ethereumjs-teku] [02-03|06:57:12] ERROR Error verifying block while running: error: invalid receipttrie (vm hf=prague -> block number=46 hash=0x9f7c5d28df41d1597b073ff577009ddb23e63bc222fbe36ae0349dfab05c6a76 hf=prague basefeepergas=3718291 txs=133 uncles=0)
```

author: parithosh
content:
you can modify the above config to add ethJS, maybe reduce the total number of clients so its runs on your machine
```
    - el_type: ethereumjs
      el_image: ethpandaops/ethereumjs:eip7840
```

author: jameshe5018
content:
in our( prysm) e2e tests for electra, we have an evaluator on validator participation at each epoch.
during the first slot of the Electra fork epoch we notice that slot always missed... this is most likely due to the transition of attestation types from pre electra to post electra.
wondering if you guys noticed something similar in testing

author: jameshe5018
content: it could also be our evaluator on e2e just just wanted to ask

author: parithosh
content: prysm hasnt missed a slot so far in the devnet, even post transition - but perhaps if they build on top of another client the bug isnt triggered?

author: jameshe5018
content: hmm perhaps it's either something with the participation evaluator itself or specific to e2e setups

author: tbenr
content:
I noticed teku complaining with 
```
Failed to decode gossip message on topic /eth2/e551da77/beacon_attestation_27/ssz_snappy, raw message: 
java.util.concurrent.CompletionException: tech.pegasys.teku.networking.eth2.gossip.encoding.DecodingException: Failed to decode gossip message
```
for the whole first electra epoch. I suspect some clients send non-singleattestation for that epoch
